hackathon-description-text: Washington University in St. Louis's Upsilon Pi Epsilon is hosting a hackathon open to all college students this fall. The hackathon will run from September 12th — 14th and will have top companies such as Google and Microsoft as sponsors. Submit an application to register!
hackathon-rules:
Rules are subject to change at any time, including during the event. 
1. Participation: Those who wish to participate must be students with either full-time or part-time student status. Exceptions to this granted upon permission from WUHack staff. 
2. Teams: Teams must consist of at least two and no more than five participants. 
3. Submissions: Each team is permitted at one submission that must be received by 12:00pm on Sunday, September 14th. Code submitted must be produced only by team members and written during the WUHack event from 5:30pm on Friday, September 12th to the submission time. By submitting a project, you and your team grant the WUHack team and organizers the unrestricted right to use your submission material, at no cost, for promotional purposes of future WUHack events.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Google Gadgets (ChromeCast, Nexus 7, Google Play Cash)
Free office space in San Francisco to pursue your hack and Free advising from WUSTL Center of Entrepreneurship
Opportunity to sell your creation to Lockerdome and Internship Interviews.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 Brookings Drive, Washington University in St. Louis, St. Louis, MO 63130, USA
hackathon-location-address: 1 Brookings Drive, Washington University in St. Louis, St. Louis, MO 63130, USA
